turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about UK Cleaning Products Industry Association.
turn.1: What is the UK Cleaning Products Industry Association?
turn.2: UK Cleaning Products Industry Association The UK Cleaning Products Industry Association is the leading trade association for companies representing UK producers of cleaning and hygiene products.
turn.3: What kind of products does the UK Cleaning Products Industry Association produce?
turn.4: This includes soaps, washing powders and liquids, household disinfectants, air care and polishes, as well as professional cleaning and hygiene products used in industrial and institutional applications.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: UKCPI runs awareness campaigns relating to product safety and energy efficiency, and provides materials for schools to teach about effective hand washing.
turn.7: When was the UK Cleaning Products Industry Association formed?
turn.8: The inaugural meeting of the Society of British Soap Makers was held at 2.30pm on 7 July 1954, at the Queens Hotel in Leeds, and was chaired by Mr RE Huffam of Unilever Limited.
turn.9: Where did the UK Cleaning Products Industry Association meet?
turn.10: Its first AGM was held at the same location, on 19 October 1955.
turn.11: Did the UK Cleaning Products Industry Association ever merge with anyone?
turn.12: In 1963, the organisation became a member of European body AIS, which later merged with FIFE to become what is now AISE.
